sentence.Network_en: The violence in those films was too unreal, it was make-believe.
sentence.Network_cn: 那些影片里的暴力场面太不真实了，都是假的。

sentence.Network_en: She used to play games of make-believe with her elder sister.
sentence.Network_cn: 她过去常跟姐姐玩扮家家的游戏。

sentence.Network_en: She squandered millions on a life of make-believe.
sentence.Network_cn: 她为一种虚幻的生活挥金如土。

entry.def: If someone is living in a make-believe world, they are pretending that things are better, different, or more exciting than they really are instead of facing up to reality.

example.ex: ...the glamorous make-believe world of show business...
example.tran: 娱乐界令人眼花缭乱的虚幻世界

example.ex: She squandered millions on a life of make-believe.
example.tran: 她为一种虚幻的生活挥金如土。

entry.def: You use make-believe to refer to the activity involved when a child plays a game in which they pretend something, for example that they are someone else.

example.ex: She used to play games of make-believe with her elder sister.
example.tran: 她过去常跟姐姐玩扮家家的游戏。

entry.tran: 虚假的;虚幻的;虚构的;假装的
entry.def: You use make-believe to describe things, for example in a play or film, that imitate or copy something real, but which are not what they appear to be.

example.ex: In the video, Michael Jackson danced down a make-believe street protesting that 'the kid is not my son'...
example.tran: 录像里，迈克尔·杰克逊沿着虚设的街道一边跳舞一边抗议说：“那孩子不是我的儿子”。

example.ex: The violence in those films was too unreal, it was make-believe...
example.tran: 那些影片里的暴力场面太不真实了，都是假的。
